person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: World number two Rodney Eyles moved within sight of his fifth title of the year on Friday when he hurried in only 40 minutes to the final of the richest squash tournament outside the World Open , the $ 105,000 Mahindra International .

Let's think step by step.

| Person |
| --- |
| Rodney Eyles |

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions one person, "Rodney Eyles". He is a world number two squash player who is in contention for the title of the $105,000 Mahindra International tournament. Therefore, "Rodney Eyles" is the only valid entity in the paragraph that falls under the category of "Person".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Person" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Person |
| --- |
| Rodney Eyles |

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions only one person, "Rodney Eyles". Although the paragraph mentions the "World number two", it does not explicitly state the name of the person holding that ranking. Therefore, "World number two" is not a valid entity under the category of "Person". The paragraph also mentions the "$105,000 Mahindra International" tournament, but it does not refer to a person, so it is not a valid entity under the category of "Person". Therefore, "Rodney Eyles" is the only valid entity in the paragraph that falls under the category of "Person".
